Description: Penannular gold ear-ring in the form of a thin rounded crescent made of solid-cast metal.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site. (?)
Curator's comments: Possibly one of the 40 gold earrings and fragments found "by the Bedawin who hunt the neighbourhood", see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.82, p.186, pl.28)
